description: This 12-week program focuses on establishing the fundamental building blocks of better sleep. Starting with the most impactful change‚Äîconsistent sleep timing‚Äîit gradually layers in simple habits that don't require dramatic lifestyle changes. The goal is to increase sleep by 20% (reaching 5-6 hours) while significantly improving sleep quality. Each intervention is introduced slowly to ensure sustainable adoption without overwhelming someone who is likely already stressed and sleep-deprived.

sections.title: Overall Goals
items: Establish consistent bedtime within 30-minute window
Increase sleep duration from 4-5 hours to 5-6 hours (20% improvement)
Create a basic 15-minute wind-down routine
Optimize sleep environment basics
Reduce major sleep disruptors

sections.title: Why It's Beneficial
items: Immediate Impact: Consistency alone can improve sleep quality within 1-2 weeks
Sustainable Changes: Small steps prevent overwhelm and increase compliance
Foundation Building: Creates habits that support all future sleep improvements
Health Protection: Moving from 4-5 to 6 hours significantly reduces health risks
Energy Improvement: Even modest gains in sleep dramatically improve daytime function

sections.title: Phase Goals
items: Begin increasing daily activity levels
Set and maintain consistent wake time (¬±15 minutes)
Begin tracking all three metrics daily
Start basic morning routine

children: Pick a bedtime you can maintain 7 days a week (even if it's late initially)
Set wake time that works for your life (work, family, obligations)
Example: If you currently sleep 2am-6am, keep it! Just make it consistent
Write these times down and post them somewhere visible
Get out of bed immediately at wake time (no snooze)
Open curtains or turn on lights
Set phone alarm 30 minutes before bedtime
When alarm goes off, begin preparing for bed
If struggling, adjust by 15 minutes to find sweet spot
Prioritize wake time consistency over bedtime
Aim for 5/7 "Yes" responses on consistency tracker
10 minutes of morning light within 1 hour of waking
Can be through window if weather is poor
Remove one source of light each week (LED clocks, chargers, etc.)

sections.title: Daily Tracking Goals for Weeks 1-4:
items: Consistency: Aim for "Yes" 5 out of 7 days
Quality: No target yet‚Äîjust observe patterns
Duration: No target yet‚Äîjust record baseline

sections.title: Common Challenges & Solutions:
items: "I can't fall asleep at my bedtime" ‚Üí Still go to bed, rest quietly, no phones
"I have social events" ‚Üí Maintain wake time even after late nights

closingNote: Advanced Sleep Science: Your brain cycles through 90-minute sleep stages (light ‚Üí deep ‚Üí REM) 4-6 times per night. Deep sleep (physical recovery) dominates the first half of night, while REM sleep (mental recovery, memory consolidation) dominates the second half. By optimizing your environment and timing, you can maximize both. Elite athletes and performers treat sleep like training - you're now doing the same.
